trans-unit.source: Used within the template of a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGrid"></xref> to specify the location in the control's visual tree where the rows are to be added.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DataGridRowsPresenter"></xref> class.

Measures the child elements of a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.VirtualizingStackPanel"></xref> in anticipation of arranging them during the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.VirtualizingStackPanel.ArrangeOverride(System.Windows.Size)"></xref> pass.
An upper limit <xref href="System.Windows.Size"></xref> that should not be exceeded.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Size"></xref> that represents the desired size of the element.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.VirtualizingStackPanel.CleanUpVirtualizedItem"></xref> event for rows that have scrolled out of view.

By default, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DataGridRowsPresenter> class maintains <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGridRow> instances only for data items that are currently on display within the user interface.
When rows are scrolled out of view, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGridRow> instances become available for garbage collection.
This <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DataGridRowsPresenter.OnCleanUpVirtualizedItem%2A> method override cancels cleanup for rows that have validation errors.
You can override this method or handle the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.VirtualizingStackPanel.CleanUpVirtualizedItem> event to provide your own logic for canceling the cleanup of particular rows.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [NIB: Raising an Event](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/f2adaf01-1ed1-42e1-8c31-8d467e7e0ee2).
The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DataGridRowsPresenter.OnCleanUpVirtualizedItem%2A> method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
The event data.
Indicates that the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Panel.IsItemsHost"></xref> property value has changed.
The old property value.
The new property value.
Called when the size of the viewport changes.
The old size of the viewport.
The new size of the viewport.
